intro: Odostemon trifolius, commonly known as the three-leaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring trifoliate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Odostemon trifolius is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
